name: improvisational
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
Speech or music that is improvisational is done or performed without being planned exactly, or is made up as it is being performed or done: A lot of the music is very improvisational. Improvisational comedy always relies on input from the audience.
More examplesFewer examplesHis improvisational approach is the source of both his strength and his occasional weakness.These courses challenge students to take risks and to improve their improvisational skills.It's more spontaneous and improvisational than other painting methods.He talked about his love of improvisational jazz music.
